The right to food is enshrined in the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights; the Convention on the Rights of the Child; and other conventions.
32 According to the Committee on Economic Social and Cultural Rights, this right ensures the accessibility and availability of food “free from adverse substances.”
33 Food supply may be at risk from fracking activities as a result of depleted water resources and the degradation of soil or water quality.
